text: EXO bionics in Berkeley California has
already engineered a full-body
enhancement exoskeleton basically means
external support system designed to
assist patients with major injuries such
as paraplegia to help them stand and
walk devices similar to this will allow
a person to carry heavier loads and
reduce the degree of fatigue to a large
degree in the next five to six years I'm
pretty sure it will replace the
wheelchair this Bionic wearable robot
was created to help people with
disabilities specifically those with
lower body paralysis get back on their
feet and move forward I didn't find it
too hard to accommodate - it really is
just a matter of practice but once you
get that down it's it's fun it feels
powerful an aluminum and titanium frame
supports a complex assembly of motors
and circuitry that weighs less than 50
pounds it works at lightning speeds to
mimic the fine art of walking both
device simply advances the light forward
and he's got to do everything else the
stride length changes based on how much
he leans if he leans past his center
spot it takes a longer step so he has a
little control over how long stride it
it's truly the first step in creating
exoskeletons as wearable as a watch and
using them will be as easy as riding a
bike
I think that exoskeletons will go beyond
just those individuals who have
disabilities when the typewriter was
first invented I mean it was primarily
used for veterans of the First World War
who could no longer write by hand and so
they could type but as otherwise healthy
people saw how fast they could type they
said well I want that technology and I
suspect the exact same thing is going to
happen with exoskeletons
